snippet: In trials, use of the experimental drugs reduced so-called bad cholesterol by about 40 to 70 percent in a matter of weeks, equivalent to the reduction achieved by the most effective statins like Lipitor.
abstract: Use of experimental drugs in trials reduced so-called bad cholesterol by about 40 to 70 percent in a matter of weeks, equivalent to the reduction achieved by the most effective statins like Lipitor; pharmaceutical companies are racing to bring drugs to market.
lead_paragraph: In trials, use of the experimental drugs reduced so-called bad cholesterol by about 40 to 70 percent in a matter of weeks, equivalent to the reduction achieved by the most effective statins like Lipitor.

headline.main: New Drugs for Lipids Set Off Race
headline.print_headline: New Drugs For Lipids Set Off Race
